Ok, I'll do all changes and adjustments and I'll commit in TIKA-2309 branch as soon as possible.
Thank you for your patience.
I'm waiting for the PR to be merged. Once it is done, I'd update the wiki.
@kinow, thanks

Sorry, I've got some questions. I've added this xml segment inside tika-mimetypes.xml:

  ```
`<mime-type` type="application/timestamped-data">
      <glob pattern="*.tsd"/>
      <glob pattern="*.TSD"/>
      <magic priority="50">
          <match value="3080060B2A864886F7" type="string" offset="0"/>
     </magic>
  `</mime-type>`

```
Is that enough to detect the new tsd mime-type, using only "new Tika().detect(file)" method invocation?
The match value="3080060B2A864886F7", is in hex format...is it right to allow the matching string pattern?

Thank you for your response.

Ok,
I've changed the pattern value in 0x3080060B2A864886F7 and now, the application/time stamped-data is detected from the new Tika().detect(file)" method invocation.

Thanks anyway.

@Shinobi75, I haven't had time to answer yet, but if you passed `File` to Tika's `detect` method it may guess by file extension. Try also on `BufferedInputStream` to be sure. I'll try to take a look this evening/night (utc+3) if I can

@grossws, thanks but the file variable is now actual an InputStream. I've just done some test without TSDDetector class and with the xml fragment:

``<mime-type` type="application/timestamped-data">
    <glob pattern="*.tsd"/>
    <glob pattern="*.TSD"/>
    <magic priority="50">
        <match value="0x3080060B2A864886F7" type="string" offset="0"/>
   </magic>
`</mime-type>`
`
and the mime-type application/timestamped-data is recognized well.
Thank you for your patience.

The only three dependencies we need to add are here:

````xml
 <dependency>
      <groupId>org.deeplearning4j</groupId>
      <artifactId>deeplearning4j-modelimport</artifactId>
      <version>0.8.0</version>
    </dependency>
    <dependency>
      <groupId>org.datavec</groupId>
      <artifactId>datavec-data-image</artifactId>
      <version>0.8.0</version>
    </dependency>
    <dependency>
      <groupId>org.nd4j</groupId>
      <artifactId>nd4j-native-platform</artifactId>
      <version>0.8.0</version>
    </dependency>
````

But i will surely cleanup my code as soon as possible. I have made some of the requested changes. Right now i am having my exams(ending on thursday.). So, I am sorry i won't be able to devote a lot of time to it, but i will pickup as soon as my exams are over. i think it will be a good idea to make a separate module for it, as we will be able to import other models also once DL4J team works imports other models. However we should see how the community reacts to it. 
I see that you are working on it, so any pull request shall be greatly appreciated !

Hey folks - a few things here. You can use classifiers to minimize OS dependencies. -platform is only a shortcut. Maven auto resolves the classifiers so it shouldn't be a big deal most of the time.

Also of note here: When deploying neural nets, you only actually need the deeplearning4j-nn module. deeplearning4j-core is datavec plus all sorts of other stuff you guys may not need.

Javacpp in general (we maintain javacpp) has -platform dependencies for ease of use (most people don't care about size and don't want to care about different OSes) but you can always use classifiers if you'd like.

-platform comes in to play with things like gradle and sbt that don't understand classifiers very well.

/cc @saudet for comments here as well.

Glad to hear this is working well!

As stated on the following page, to reduce the dependencies to a single platform, we can set the `javacpp.platform` system property to the one we are interested in:
https://github.com/bytedeco/javacpp-presets/blob/master/README.md#downloads

@agibsonccc Thanks for the message and bringing @saudet to the discussion.

Hi @saudet, you nailed it! `-Djavacpp.platform=` is exactly the one I was looking for. Thanks :-)

I had tried the newer version. The problems faced: The SentimentME models did not work(They have renamed the classes). So we have to retrain models to upgrade the OpenNLP
They worked fine using the old openNLP try with that

1. The categorical datasets links in Datasets page is broken, we have to fix it too. http://irds.usc.edu/SentimentAnalysisParser/datasets.html 
2. The Models page has no models linked, the paths mentioned in the web page doesnt exists in the repo. http://irds.usc.edu/SentimentAnalysisParser/models.html. I am hoping the Categorical analysis (or multi class classifier in simple words) should work simply by changing the `modelPath` parameter in tika config XML (Please give me a link to model, I will test it :+1: ). OK, here are two things we need to put in the wiki guide for this (and also we need to update the TikaAndVision page with this):

* On Mac, [Docker Containers Don't Run on the Host Machine itself](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/35878297/cant-connect-to-docker-containers-on-osx). This means that in order to use `localhost` like we specify in our instructions, you have to fiddle with Virtual Box (which is the VM server that Docker, and Docker-Machine work with).
* To fiddle with Virtual Box, and get it to expose our port, 8764, you need to [enable and add the specified port forwarding rules to your Virtual Box default machine](https://jhipster.github.io/tips/020_tip_using_docker_containers_as_localhost_on_mac_and_windows.html). You can find instructions on how to do that in the previous link, and you should add a rule for 8764 and 8764, and map it to 127.0.0.1. After that you're set!
